body: I'll have a look this morning

I've seen this happening in goreleaser build sometimes as well... 
AFAIK your config is right... maybe it's a bug in fpm?
I've tried pinning my install to a few different versions of fpm, but it doesn't seem to make a difference. I will be more systematic and try a few different versions of fpm.

I had a similar issue trying to run goreleaser locally on my macbook. @drewsonne—the line you linked to is actually just a warning (which I still get when I run fpm manually), but the actual error is thrown here: https://travis-ci.org/drewsonne/go-gocd/jobs/264257111#L910. It looks like the warning is only printed when there is an error as well.

Locally, the fix for me was using the GNU version of tar (1.29) as opposed to the BSD version I had installed by default (2.8.3). I'm not sure whether that will help in your case, though.

I'm getting this erratically when running in travis, myself. 

https://travis-ci.org/devopsdays/devopsdays-cli/builds/284277489

We also still get this on Travis for the goreleaser repo itself. For now, all we can to is restart these builds.
In the last 7 days we got this error 3 times out of 39.
https://travis-ci.org/goreleaser/goreleaser/builds/282349303
https://travis-ci.org/goreleaser/goreleaser/builds/282331489
https://travis-ci.org/goreleaser/goreleaser/builds/282192408
@rliebz how did you specify the GNU version of tar? or are you controlling the build environment so `tar` links to `gtar`?

@drewsonne This wouldn't fix it on Travis, but if you're doing things on macOS:

```bash
brew install gnu-tar
export PATH="/usr/local/opt/gnu-tar/libexec/gnubin:$PATH"
```

And just make sure you set your path in your `.bash_profile` or any time you run `fpm`.

As for Travis, it looks like from your logs that it's the `tar` step that failed, but it's not necessarily true that the reason the command failed for you is the same reason it failed for me—all the logs really indicate is that `tar` is the step that failed.

After trying to automate my releases, I was running into the same error on CircleCI reproducibly. I believe in my case it was permission issues based on how I was able to fix it.

- Same error as above is here: https://circleci.com/gh/rliebz/tusk/75#config/containers/0
  - While CircleCI doesn't let me link lines, the command I ran is on line `63`
- Successful version is here: https://circleci.com/gh/rliebz/tusk/82#config/containers/0
  - Lines `64-66` are the fix I used, although someone more fluent in `bash` may know of a cleaner syntax to get similar results
- The `.goreleaser.yml` I used is the same between both of the above builds: https://github.com/rliebz/tusk/blob/v0.1.4/.goreleaser.yml

Based on the discussion above, it seems this error message can be caused by any failure while running `tar`. I've managed to trigger it for at least two different errors in two different environments. 

A solution for the general case might be to see if we can't get the `stdout`/`stderr` from the `tar` command on failures to help with debugging, since there may or may not be anything `goreleaser` can do depending on the cause of failure.

issue.title: chore: passing down --debug to fpm
issue.body:
This shall helps in the cases fpm is failing for an unknown reason.

refs #333

body:
```
{:timestamp=>"2017-10-19T22:54:48.593577+0000", :message=>"tar: ./usr/local/bin/goreleaser: file changed as we read it", :level=>:info, :file=>"cabin/mixins/pipe.rb", :line=>"47", :method=>"block in pipe"}
```

https://travis-ci.org/goreleaser/goreleaser/builds/290224710#L1065

maybe is something related to the concurrency? maybe fpm doesn't handle it very well...

issue.title: fix: fpm fails randomly
issue.body:
FPM would randomly fail to build deb and rpm packages. It apparently
happens because fpm (or some tool it uses) shares state between runs
(possibly by overriding files that are going inside the archive).

The error `file changed as we read it` was happening, which is a `tar`
error.

I don't know how to fix this, but, in order to make goreleaser more
stable, I'll disable the concurrency here for now.

closes #333

## Types of changes

<!--- What types of changes does your code introduce? Put an `x` in all the boxes that apply: -->

- [x] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [x] I have read the **CONTRIBUTING** document.
- [x] `make ci` passes on my machine.

body:
check #407 

I ran:

```console
while true; do
  go test -v ./pipeline/fpm/... || break
done
```

before and after my changes.

Before it broke after 5min or so.

After, I let it run for 15min and it didn't failed. I'm assuming the concurrency is the issue here :/

issue.title: Running multiple fpm at the same time causes tar to error eventualy

repository.name: fpm
repository.description: Effing package management! Build packages for multiple platforms (deb, rpm, etc) with great ease and sanity.

issue.body:
Hi!

Thanks for the awesome software!

I'm the author of [goreleaser](https://github.com/goreleaser/goreleaser), which integrates with fpm.

We were running several fpm instances in parallel, meaning that one fpm instance would be packaging for linux amd64 deb and other instance might be doing the same for rpm or maybe linux x86.

Anyway, eventually, an error came out.

I added the debug flag so I could find out what was happening. Got this:

```
{:timestamp=>"2017-10-19T22:54:48.593577+0000", :message=>"tar: ./usr/local/bin/goreleaser: file changed as we read it", :level=>:info, :file=>"cabin/mixins/pipe.rb", :line=>"47", :method=>"block in pipe"}
```

https://travis-ci.org/goreleaser/goreleaser/builds/290224710#L1065

So, seems like fpm (or maybe another tool fpm uses?) is putting files in the same temp folder or something, causing `tar` to warn that a file changed.

More info:

- https://github.com/goreleaser/goreleaser/issues/333
- https://github.com/goreleaser/goreleaser/pull/407

For now, I disabled the concurrency in that part of the code.

Anyway, would love to see if this can be fixed here (if it belongs here).

Thanks, and let me know if I can help in any way!

body:
I'm using `go get -u github.com/goreleaser/goreleaser`, which I assume pulls master? But I just got this same error as described in this thread: https://travis-ci.org/tombh/texttop/builds/336471125

Edit: Unfold the very last line of the logs: `$REPO_ROOT/contrib/release_if_new_version.sh` to see the error.
